page.title: 20General (2)
page.content: School provision in Lambeth has recently been reorganised at Secondary level. Schools have by and large become bigger. The population trend is outwards from the North of the Borough and a reorganisation of Electoral Boundaries also reflects this fact. In addition to Aided and Voluntary Schools, some denominational ones still exist. Local centres of entertainment include a dance hall, cinemas and several parks, including Brocwell Park which doubles as an athletic track. Much of the entertainment is also provided by clubs and private houses, where Blues are a regular feature of night-life. The area has two main roads - the A3 and A23 to Brighton - which run through the section. They are very busy roads!
